intro: Zerna tyttholepis, commonly known as the mountain zerna, is a perennial herb native to high-altitude regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Zerna tyttholepis is often found in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in mountainous ecosystems.
